lines.text:
[entering classroom and seeing smoke]
All you boys, out. Girls stay where you are. Out.
[closes door]

I am sick of your foul language, your crude behavior and your sluttish manner. There are certain things a decent woman keeps private, and only a filthy slut would have done this and those who stood by and encouraged her are just as bad. I don't care who's responsible - you're all to blame. Now, I am going to leave this room for five minutes by which time that disgusting object had better be removed and the windows opened to clear away the stench. If you must play these filthy games, do them in your homes, and not in my classroom!
It seems you know so little, and are so easily amused, I can look forward to a very happy time.
If you want to dance wif me, you bleedin' well ask proper!
I believe one should fight for what one believes. Provided one is absolutely sure one is absolutely right.
Do you two...
[wiggling her hips]
Do you two shake?

[reading from her school book]
And he had learned to love, I know not why, for this in such as him seemed strange of mood. But thus it was and though in solitude's small part the nipped affections have to grow, in him this glowed when all beside had ceased to glow.

[talking to Mark about Pamela Dare on the bus]
Make no mistake about Pamela... she's a woman in every sense of the word.
Sir, would you dance with me tonight?
Of course, but nothing too fast. I'm getting much too old for that sort of thing Miss Dare.
We'll make it something special, promise?
Promise.
Sir, would you call me Pamela tonight?
Yes... Pamela.
You ever been broke, Sir? Real broke? Skint?
Yup. Many, many, many times.
Oh, I don't understand you a bit Sir. I mean, you're a toff, and you ain't.
Huh?
Sir, what he means is, blimey, I can't sorta put it into words, or anything, but...
Well, Sir, you're like us, but you ain't, I mean, you're not. It's kinda scary, but nice. You know what I mean, don't you?
Well, I... I don't know how to answer you, except to say that I teach you truths. My truths. Yeah, and it is kinda scary, dealing with the truth. Scary, and dangerous...
If you apologize because you are afraid, then you're a child, not a man.
Who does he think he is there? Cheeky devil.

[to Pamela Dare]
I know what's bothering you! You fancy him!
Marriage is not for the weak, the selfish, the insecure.
Oooh, look at me! I am a lady, I am!
[sticks out tongue]
